intro: Centaurea tenuisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved knapweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellow to reddish-brown flowers throughout the summer. Centaurea tenuisecta is generally hardy and can tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in arid environments.
